title: [Self-Directed] Preference Analysis of Print and Digital Resources in University Libraries

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of introductory statistical analysis and research methods
context.additional_context: A language education program for professional learners in medical, legal, and technical fields, conducted in a limited technological environment (no PC, smartphone-centric), applying a blended learning structure focused on formative assessment.

learning_goals: Learners can design a survey explaining preferences and influencing factors for library resource types (print/electronic).
Learners can perform basic statistical analyses (Chi-Square, Mann-Whitney, etc.) on collected response data using tools like SPSS.
Based on analysis results, learners can present resource preference patterns according to specific contexts (major/year/sex, etc.).

resources: Smartphone, survey template, SPSS trial version, statistical analysis guide PDF
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
